canvases.label: Maw And Co.'s Patterns, Geometrical and Roman Mosaics, Encaustic Tile Pavements and Enamelled Wall Decorations, pl.19

metadata.value: Maw And Co.'s Patterns, Geometrical and Roman Mosaics, Encaustic Tile Pavements and Enamelled Wall Decorations
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: Date from printed circular letter from G.H. Potts to his Edinburgh customers, which is bound in: New pattern book. Maw & Co.'s mosaic and encaustic tile pavements, majolica, and enamelled wall tiles, &c.
metadata.label: Date Info

metadata.value: Opening their company in 1850, George and Arthur Maw created lavish tiles out of their Edinburgh factory. This catalogue book was produced 17 years into the company’s history as a means to showcase their products. Each page is headed and labelled as ‘Maw and Co’s Encaustic Tiles/Tile Pavements, Benthall Works, Broseley, Shropshire’ with each title describing its true size once ordered and how many tiles are in a grouping shown to achieve a full/partial picture. Maw and Co still exists after many reincarnations of the company and can be found at http://www.mawandco.com/company-profile-2. This company at one time was the largest producers of tiles in the world and served high status customers such as the Royal Family, Alexander II of Russia and many other dukes, earls and other institutions of high calibre.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Quarter brown cloth, with decorated, lithographed paper over boards. Brass cornerpieces (missing from front board). Cover design signed 'Owen Jones'. As issued.
metadata.label: Material

metadata.value: Edinburgh : George H. Potts, agent, 92 Princes Street
metadata.label: Production Place

metadata.value: Maw And Co.'s Patterns, Geometrical and Roman Mosaics, Encaustic Tile Pavements and Enamelled Wall Decorations
metadata.label: Related Work Title

metadata.value: Ink inscription at head of p.[1]: John Paris Esq Architect 25 Cumberland Street with Geoff Potts Compts
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

metadata.value: Maw And Co.'s Patterns, Geometrical and Roman Mosaics, Encaustic Tile Pavements and Enamelled Wall Decorations, pl.19
metadata.label: Repro Title
